美国周三采取了一系列措施，表明伊朗的导弹计划在联合国安理会制裁到期后仍将受到限制，并遏制伊朗向俄罗斯转让无人机。

俄罗斯周二表示，自周三联合国制裁失效后，向伊朗转让导弹技术不再需要安理会批准，但没有透露现在是否计划支持德黑兰的导弹开发。

美国努力限制伊朗的导弹和无人机计划之际，德黑兰再次批评其支持哈马斯，哈马斯于 10 月 7 日对以色列南部社区发动跨境袭击，造成至少 1,300 人死亡。

联合国制裁的到期属于已失效的2015年伊朗核协议的“日落”条款，该协议使德黑兰免受美国、欧盟和联合国的制裁，以换取限制其核计划。美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普于 2018 年放弃了该协议，并恢复了美国对伊朗的制裁。

尽管美国总统乔·拜登政府恢复协议对伊朗核计划限制的努力失败了，但联合国的制裁仍按照协议的要求到期。

美国表示将对伊朗导弹、无人机和常规武器行业的实体和个人实施新的制裁。它还向旨在防止双重用途技术落入伊朗行为者手中的企业发布了咨询。

一位高级官员表示：“这些制裁除了限制伊朗的常规武器转让以及与委内瑞拉和俄罗斯等国家的持续军事关系外，还将对伊朗的导弹和无人机计划施加压力，其中包括伊朗提供莫斯科用于打击乌克兰民用目标的无人机。”一位不愿透露姓名的部门官员告诉记者。

美国国务院还计划发表超过 45 个国家的声明，承诺通过所谓的“防扩散安全倡议”打击伊朗的导弹相关活动，该计划是在乔治·W·布什总统任期内启动的，旨在防止大规模杀伤性武器的运输。

爱沙尼亚总理卡亚·卡拉斯周三表示，欧盟成员国匈牙利总理与俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京握手的画面“非常非常不愉快”，考虑到布达佩斯与莫斯科过去的历史，这不符合逻辑。

匈牙利与俄罗斯的关系比其他欧盟国家更为密切，并被视为12月决定是否与乌克兰开启入盟谈判的主要潜在反对者，该决定需要得到欧盟27个成员国的一致支持。

欧尔班·维克托和普京周二在中国举行了盛大的会谈。欧尔班在俄罗斯电视台播出时告诉普京，他从未想过反对莫斯科，并正在努力挽救双边接触。

乌克兰最坚定的捍卫者之一卡拉斯在巴黎接受路透社采访时表示：“看到这种情况非常非常不愉快。” “你怎么能和一个发动过侵略战争的罪犯握手，尤其是来自像匈牙利这样有历史的国家呢？”

国际刑事法院（ICC）今年3月对普京发出逮捕令，指控他犯有从乌克兰非法驱逐儿童的战争罪。

卡拉斯说：“匈牙利发生的事情以及俄罗斯人在那里所做的事情并不遥远。”

1956年匈牙利起义被苏联坦克和军队镇压。至少2600名匈牙利人和600名苏联士兵在战斗中丧生。

在与法国总统马克龙举行会谈后，卡拉斯表示，乌克兰的盟友不应因其他冲突而分心，而应加倍努力，以表明他们将长期参与其中。

她说，当务之急是通过增加新的制裁来“增加侵略成本”，紧急解决规避现有措施的问题，并找到基辅使用冻结资产的方法。

“冲突没有被冻结，而是一场消耗战，”她说。 “俄罗斯认为他们能够忍受痛苦的时间比我们忍受痛苦的时间长得多，这也是可以理解的，他（普京）确实在玩弄这一点。”

当被问及明年的美国大选是否会改变游戏规则时，她表示，华盛顿的盟友将不得不与掌权者打交道，但到目前为止，在她与民主党和共和党的会谈中，仍然有强烈的声音支持乌克兰。

随着以色列和哈马斯之间的战争愈演愈烈，人们的注意力立即从乌克兰和该地区的其他热点问题上转移开，例如阿塞拜疆在纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的军事行动的后果以及西巴尔干地区紧张局势的加剧。

“当然，中东战争夺走了所有其他讨论的氧气。这是现实，但这并不意味着我们应该失去对这些领域的兴趣，”卡拉斯说。

目击者告诉路透社，过去六个月与苏丹军队作战的准军事部队最近几周不断前进，并试图巩固他们在首都的影响力。

4 月 15 日，苏丹军队与准军事快速支援部队 (RSF) 之间因计划向文官统治过渡而引发的紧张局势爆发了战斗。它摧毁了首都喀土穆，并在达尔富尔引发了种族驱动的袭击。

调解人暂停谈判几个月后，这场导致超过 575 万人流离失所、数千人死亡并摧毁主要城市的战争似乎没有明显的赢家，也看不到结束的迹象。

无国界医生组织迅速控制了首都，居民指责其抢劫和占领房屋。保持对基地控制的军队发动了大规模空袭和炮火。

无国界医生组织现在似乎试图向南移动，前往杰济拉州，这是一个重要的农业区和人口中心。数十万人以及一些从喀土穆流离失所的政府和人道主义职能人员已转移到那里。

目击者称，上周，无国界武装力量控制了通往迈达尼路线之一的主要城镇艾拉丰，他们抢劫了数千名居民，使他们流离失所，许多人步行逃离。

逃亡者之一阿姆纳说：“攻击如此猛烈，士兵们的弹药都用完了，不得不跑回基地。”

战争爆发后不久，该部队还继续对首都以西的尼亚拉和埃尔奥贝德发动猛烈攻击。

军方表示，其士兵，特别是特种部队，正在反击这些进攻。

在喀土穆境内，无国界医生组织对多个陆军基地发动了袭击，包括陆军主要司令部和装甲兵基地。

目击者称，在尼罗河对岸的恩图曼，无国界医生组织一直在使用远程火炮来攻击至关重要的瓦迪萨伊德纳空军基地，而此前这些远程火炮是该准军事组织无法触及的。

目击者称，在那次行动中，无国界医生组织于 10 月 9 日炮击了医疗援助机构无国界医生组织运营的一家医院，造成两人死亡，并引起了广泛谴责。

据当地居民称，无国界医生组织本月在杰贝勒奥利亚地区喀土穆南部的一个军事基地发起了另一场行动，造成 45 人死亡，一名律师组织表示，该组织并未指责任何一方。

他说，导弹在田野中爆炸，没有造成人员伤亡或基础设施损坏。

黎巴嫩真主党周三警告其对手，其武装分子在哈马斯和以色列之间的战争助长的暴力事件中与以色列军队在边境交火，其实力比以前“强大数千倍”。

美国警告支持真主党和巴勒斯坦组织哈马斯的伊朗不要卷入这场危机，并部署了两艘航空母舰，称其目的是威慑任何试图使战争升级的国家或非国家行为者。

真主党官员哈希姆·萨菲丁在向数千名支持者发表讲话时表示，美国总统乔·拜登、以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡和“恶意的欧洲人”应该小心。

他说：“对于我们的抵抗可能犯下的错误，我们将作出响亮的回应。”

“因为我们拥有的是信仰，上帝比你们、你们所有的战舰和你们所有的武器更强大，”他在一次集会上发表讲话说，该集会是为了回应加沙一家医院发生的导致数百人死亡的袭击。

自10月7日哈马斯袭击以色列、以色列对加沙进行猛烈空袭回应以来，真主党和以色列几乎每天都在边境交火。

真主党表示，周三袭击了五个地点，包括扎里特的以色列军营和黎巴嫩拉斯纳库拉地区边境的一个阵地，其中几次袭击使用了制导导弹。

以色列军队表示，这是对扎里特地区军事哨所的枪击事件做出的回应，也是在武装分子向以色列边境附近的马纳拉基布兹和罗什哈尼克拉发射反坦克导弹后做出的回应。

军方表示将“继续打击真主党恐怖组织的恐怖目标”。

这是真主党和以色列2006年开战以来最严重的边境战斗。

真主党周三宣布，一名武装分子因周二受伤死亡，周二暴力事件中死亡的真主党武装分子人数增加至六人。

消息人士称，真主党上周的袭击迄今为止已得到遏制，避免了一场重大战争。真主党副领导人纳伊姆·卡西姆 (Naim Qassem) 10 月 13 日表示，该组织将在时机成熟时采取行动。

以色列国防部长10月15日表示，以色列没有兴趣在其北部战线发动战争，如果真主党保持克制，以色列也将维持边境局势现状。

法国最高行政法院周三驳回了针对法国内政部长禁止所有亲巴勒斯坦抗议活动的指示的上诉，同时表示地方当局应评估每个案件对公共秩序的风险。

在 10 月 12 日发给地区警察当局的一份照会中，内政部长下令“必须禁止支持巴勒斯坦的抗议活动，因为它们可能会扰乱公共秩序”。

巴勒斯坦行动委员会对全面禁令指令提出上诉，认为全面和绝对的禁令是不合理的，并且侵犯了言论和集会自由。

最高行政法院在其裁决中表示，虽然法官对部长说明中的近似措辞感到遗憾，但其目的是指示当局“禁止所有支持巴勒斯坦事业、直接或间接公开为恐怖分子辩护或鼓吹恐怖分子的抗议活动”。其行为与 10 月 7 日哈马斯成员在以色列犯下的罪行类似。”

它补充说，当局不能仅仅根据这份说明就决定禁止抗议活动，并且考虑到法国的紧张局势和反犹太主义的抬头，“支持哈马斯（......）的抗议活动具有挑起公共秩序骚乱的性质”。

巴勒斯坦行动委员会的律师文森特·布伦加斯 (Vincent Brengarth) 在做出决定前对路透社表示，“说支持巴勒斯坦的抗议活动本质上会扰乱公共秩序是没有意义的——看看世界其他地方，数千人为巴勒斯坦举行抗议活动。”

周三，在裁决前几个小时，马赛警方表示，将禁止两场支持巴勒斯坦的抗议活动，因为“在当前情况下对公共秩序构成风险”。

所有三名前军官均被基辅斯维亚托申地方法院缺席判刑，因为他们于 2019 年通过囚犯交换被移交给俄罗斯。

另外两名前军官出庭。法院称，其中一人被判服刑，另一人被无罪释放。

此案的重点是 2 月 20 日 48 名抗议者被杀，这是基辅市中心抗议活动与安全部队发生冲突的最后一天，也是最血腥的一天，这场冲突导致了总统维克多·亚努科维奇(Viktor Yanukovych)下台，这场革命被称为独立广场革命。

亚努科维奇逃往俄罗斯。 2019年，乌克兰一家法院缺席判处他叛国罪和教唆俄罗斯2014年入侵克里米亚和乌克兰东部罪。他否认有不当行为。

自革命以来，尽管俄罗斯于 2022 年 2 月发动全面入侵，乌克兰仍制定了亲西方路线并开始改革，寻求加入欧盟。

The head of orthopedic surgery at Al-Ahli al-Arabi Hospital in Gaza, Fadel Naim, had just finished a procedure when he heard a huge explosion and his department filled with people screaming for help.

"People came running into the surgery department screaming help us, help us, there are people killed and wounded inside the hospital," he said. He found the hospital full of dismembered bodies and wounded people.

"We tried to save whoever could be saved but the number was too great for the hospital team," he said.

Tuesday's explosion killed hundreds of Palestinians and wrecked a diplomatic mission by US President Joe Biden, who arrived in Israel on Wednesday to calm the region but was snubbed by Arab leaders who called off an emergency summit.

Palestinian officials blamed an Israeli air strike for the blast. Israel said the blast was caused by a failed rocket launch by the Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group, which denied blame.

Doctor Ibrahim Al-Naqa was proud of the 100-year-old baptist hospital. In a region of conflict, it welcomed all faiths, offering patients a church and a mosque.

On Tuesday, people seeking shelter from the fiercest fighting between the Israeli military and the Palestinian militant group Hamas in decades walked into the hospital to their deaths.

Blood stained the walls and the ground in what was normally a peaceful place that helped patients recover.

"This place created a safe haven for women and children, those who escaped the Israeli bombing into this hospital, those who saw this place as a safe haven," said Naqa.

"Without warning this hospital was targeted. We don't know what the shell is called but we saw the results of it when it targeted children and ripped their bodies into pieces."

REGION IN CRISIS

The death toll from the hospital explosion was by far the highest of any single incident in Gaza during the current violence, and saw protests erupt in the occupied West Bank and the wider region, including in Jordan and Turkey.

The blast inflamed a region in crisis after Hamas, which controls the Gaza Strip, carried out a cross-border rampage against communities in southern Israel on Oct. 7 in which at least 1,300 people were killed and hostages were taken.

Israel responded with the heaviest ever air strikes on the blockaded Gaza Strip and has massed troops and tanks on its border.

Israel's military on Wednesday published what it described as evidence that a misfired Palestinian rocket caused the hospital explosion. Hamas said it was an Israeli air strike and an Islamic Jihad spokesman rejected Israeli accusations as "cover to justify carrying out its massacres against Palestinian civilians".

Before Tuesday's blast, health authorities in Gaza said at least 3,000 people had died in 11 days of Israeli bombardment.

The scenes of destruction from the hospital were horrific even by the standards of the past days, which have confronted the world with relentless images, first of Israelis slaughtered in their homes and then of Palestinian families buried under rubble from Israel's retaliatory strikes.

A Gaza civil defence chief gave a death toll of 300 at the hospital, while health ministry sources put it at 500. Bodies were still being pulled from the rubble on Wednesday.

"The massacre carried out by the Israeli occupation at the Baptist Hospital is the massacre of the 21st century and it is a continuation of its crimes since the Nakba of our people in 1948," said Salama Marouf, head of the Hamas government media office.

" Nakba ", or "catastrophe", refers to when many Palestinians fled or were forced from their homes during the 1948 war that accompanied Israel's creation.

  • Duma passes law with swift series of votes
  • Russia says move restores symmetry with United States
  • Arms control experts worry Moscow inching towards test
  • 1996 CTBT has made nuclear tests taboo

Russia's parliament moved swiftly to fulfil the wish of President Vladimir Putin by completing the passage of a bill that shifts Moscow's legal stance on nuclear testing at a time of acute tension with the West.

The lower house, the State Duma, on Wednesday passed the second and third readings of a bill that revokes Russia's ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty . Both were passed unanimously by 415 votes to zero.

Putin urged the Duma on Oct. 5 to make the change in order to "mirror" the position of the United States, which has signed but never ratified the 1996 treaty.

"We understand our responsibility to our citizens, we are protecting our country. What is happening in the world today is the exclusive fault of the United States," parliament speaker Vyacheslav Volodin said.

Russia says it will not resume testing unless Washington does, but arms control experts are concerned it may be inching towards a test that the West would perceive as a Russian nuclear escalation amid the Ukraine war.

They say a test by either Russia or the United States could prompt the other to do the same, and China, India and Pakistan might then follow, triggering a new global arms race. All are currently observing test moratoriums, and only North Korea has conducted a test involving a nuclear explosion this century.

Russia originally ratified the CTBT in 2000. While it is revoking that step, it has so far said it will remain a signatory to the treaty and continue to supply data to the global monitoring system which alerts the world to any nuclear test.

But when he introduced the bill on Tuesday, parliament speaker Volodin raised the possibility Moscow might withdraw altogether, and said it would keep Washington guessing about its intentions.

"And what we will do next - whether we remain a party to the treaty or not, we will not tell them. We must think about global security, the safety of our citizens and act in their interests," he said.

The law will now go to the upper house, and to Putin for signing.

Putin said on Oct. 5 that he was aware of calls for Russia to resume nuclear testing but was not ready to say whether Moscow should do so or not.

Back in February, he said Russia must "make everything ready" to conduct a test in case Washington did so. Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu visited Russia's testing ground in the remote northern archipelago of Novaya Zemlya in August.

CNN published satellite images last month showing Russia, the United States and China have all built new facilities at their nuclear test sites in recent years.

Russia's shift on the CTBT follows its suspension earlier this year of New START, the last remaining bilateral nuclear treaty with the United States, which limits the number of strategic warheads each side can deploy.

Experts at the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute said both steps may be intended by Putin "to generate alarm and uncertainty among states supporting Ukraine in its defence against Russia's illegal invasion".

They said the CTBT move "weakens international stability and diminishes humanity's prospects of avoiding a new nuclear arms race".

But they added: "In this instance, it is difficult for the United States to go far in criticizing Putin's announcement and Russia's potential withdrawal from the CTBT since the USA has itself failed to ratify the treaty and become a party to it in the 27 years since first signing."

Melissa Parke, executive director of the International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons, called Russia's action irresponsible.

She said treaties like the CTBT "are critical to making sure nuclear testing which has harmed people's health and caused widespread radioactive contamination is not resumed".

周三罕见的视频显示，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京在北京陪同携带所谓核公文包的官员，该公文包可用于下令进行核打击。

普京在北京与中国国家主席习近平会面后，被拍到在安保人员的簇拥下步行前往另一场会议，身后跟着两名身着制服的俄罗斯海军军官，每人都提着公文包。镜头拉近其中一个公文包。

俄罗斯的核公文包传统上由海军军官携带。这个公文包被称为“Cheget”（以高加索山脉的切格特山命名），总统一直随身携带这个公文包，但很少被拍摄到。

国家通讯社RIA的克里姆林宫记者在Telegram上的视频下发帖称，“如果没有某些手提箱，普京的旅行就不算完整。”

在另一段视频中，普京在北京与海军军官会面后走出会议，再次拍摄到距普京仅几步之遥的地方，普京笑着走下楼梯。

美国总统也有这样的装置——叫做“核足球”。挎包里装有总统不在白宫时用来验证发射核导弹命令的代码。

乌克兰战争已将莫斯科和华盛顿之间的紧张关系提升至1962年古巴导弹危机以来的最高水平，而此时中国正寻求增强其核武库以符合其新兴超级大国的地位。

俄罗斯议会周二迈出了撤销批准《全面禁止核试验条约》的第一步，其最高议员警告美国，莫斯科甚至可能完全放弃该条约。

从本质上讲，公文包是一种安全的通信工具，可通过高度机密的“卡兹别克”电子指挥和控制网络将总统与其军事高层联系起来，进而与火箭部队联系起来。 Kazbek 支持另一个称为“Kavkaz”的系统。

现任俄罗斯国防部长谢尔盖·绍伊古也有一个核公文包。现任总参谋长瓦列里·格拉西莫夫也可能有一名。

俄罗斯 Zvezda 电视频道2019 年播放的视频显示了其中一个带有一系列按钮的公文包。

在名为“命令”的部分中有两个按钮：白色的“启动”按钮和红色的“取消”按钮。据《红星报》报道，公文包由一张特殊的抽认卡激活。

普京正在访问北京，这是他自 2022 年 2 月乌克兰战争爆发以来第二次离开前苏联。

US President Joe Biden flies to Israel on Wednesday to signal support for its war against Hamas after a deadly blast at a Gaza City hospital inflamed tensions and led to the cancellation of his planned summit with Arab leaders.

A Gaza health ministry spokesperson said hundreds died at the Al-Ahli al-Arabi hospital after what Palestinian officials said was an Israeli air strike.

Israel blamed the blast on a failed rocket launch by the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group, which denied responsibility.

Reuters could not immediately verify the claims nor the death toll.

The health ministry spokesperson, Ashraf Al-Qudra, said hundreds were killed and rescuers were still pulling bodies from the rubble. Earlier, a Gaza civil defence chief gave a death toll of 300, while health ministry sources put it at 500.

Regardless of who was responsible or how many may have died, the incident has inflamed a region already in crisis since Hamas carried out an Oct. 7 cross-border rampage against communities in southern Israel in which at least 1,300 people died.

Al Jazeera carried footage showing a frantic scene as rescue workers scoured blood-stained rubble for survivors.救援人员和平民用尸袋抬走了至少四名遇难者。

Before Tuesday's blast, health authorities in Gaza said at least 3,000 people had died in Israel's 11-day bombardment that began after the Oct. 7 assault, which caught Israel by surprise and led to nearly 200 people being taken to Gaza as hostages.

In one sign of the fraught situation facing Biden, Jordan canceled a planned summit with the US president, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi. Abbas canceled plans to meet Biden after the hospital blast.

在另一起事件中，巴勒斯坦安全部队在被占领的约旦河西岸城市拉马拉发射催泪瓦斯和眩晕手榴弹驱散抗议者，抗议者投掷石块并高呼反对阿巴斯的口号，民众愤怒沸腾。

以色列驻土耳其和约旦大使馆以及美国驻黎巴嫩大使馆附近也发生了抗议活动，安全部队向示威者发射催泪瓦斯。

人道主义援助

白宫国家安全发言人约翰·柯比在拜登飞往特拉维夫时对记者表示， 拜登将向以色列领导人提出“尖锐的问题” ，但没有透露细节。

柯比说，拜登将与以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡和以色列战时内阁会面，以了解以色列的计划和目标。

柯比说：“他会问一些棘手的问题，他会以朋友、以色列真正的朋友的身份来问他们，但他也会问他们一些问题。”

Biden has previously said the United States does not want the conflict to metastasize into a wider war, and that it wants humanitarian aid to flow into Gaza despite an Israeli "siege" that has blocked food, fuel and water supplies.

"We feel optimistic that that kind of assistance will start to flow," Kirby said.

Biden will also meet with Israeli first responders and families of those who lost loved ones or whose family members are hostages of Hamas. An estimated 200 people were taken back to Gaza as hostages after the Oct. 7 Hamas attack.

Biden left Washington on Tuesday on what was supposed to be a complex diplomatic mission, aimed at showing support for long-time US ally Israel, calming the region and shoring up humanitarian efforts for Gaza.

在医院罢工、有关责任的相互矛盾的报道以及约旦峰会被取消之后，尚不清楚他能完成什么。 Kirby said Biden planned to speak with Abbas and Sisi on his way back to Washington.

国际危机组织联合国主任理查德·高恩表示：“这种阴暗但可怕的事件使外交变得更加困难，并增加了升级风险。”

One person was killed and at least two wounded after an apartment building was destroyed in a Russian air attack on the city of Zaporizhzhia, the governor of the Zaporizhzhia region in Ukraine said on Wednesday.

"Residents of the building were evacuated," Yuriy Malashko, governor of the Zaporizhzhia region, said on the Telegram messaging app. "Eight apartments buildings were damaged."

The city of Zaporizhzhia is the administrative centre of the broader Zaporizhzhia region in southeast Ukraine, which is now partially controlled by Russia.

Earlier, a Moscow-installed official in the Russia-controlled parts of Zaporizhzhia, blamed the strikes in the city on Ukrainian forces.
